results.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
results.brief_description: James Stewart stars as naive young Jefferson Smith, the well-loved head of a chain of boys’ clubs, who is unwittingly set up by a group of unscrupulous politicians and sent to Washington as a Senator. He is expected to vote as the party machine dictates and so ease the passage of a fraudulent Bill. Jeff discovers the double-deal and the normally mild mannered good guy turns into a veritable “house on fire” to attack the web of corruption that surrounds him.

results.title: The Day of the Triffids
results.brief_description: The few who retain their eyesight are horrified to see the Triffids normally small plants - grow to huge proportions as they become affected by the presence of the mysterious meteorites. As the Triffids multiply by the millions, they begin a march on civilisation, brutally destroying everyone in their path. Based on the book by John Wyndham. Rated: PG

results.title: A Room with a view
results.creator_credit: James Ivory, Ismail Merchant and Merchant Ivory Productions
results.brief_description: Based on E M Forster’s classic novel, this film tells the story of a young English couple who encounter passion in Italy and, defying the Victorian conventions of their elders, dare to be true to their emotions and each other. Stars Helena Bonham-Carter, Maggie Smith, Denholm Elliot and Julian Sands.

results.title: Parlor, Bedroom and Bath
results.brief_description: parlor, Bedroom and Bath, stars Buster Keaton in one of his rare talkies, a masterpiece of comedy in which our disaster prone hero is mistaken for a rich playboy and becomes romantically involved with two high society sisters. Largely filmed in Keaton’s own home, “Parlor, Bedroom and Bath” typically depicts Keaton’s knack of portraying the wacky side of life.

results.title: A Walk in the Sun
results.brief_description: Powerful and bold in its story, ‘A Walk in the Sun’ is unforgettable in its drama. The masterful director of “All Quiet on the Western Front” has again captured the deepest emotions of men at war.
results.description: Powerful and bold in its story, ‘A Walk in the Sun’ is unforgettable in its drama. The masterful director of “All Quiet on the Western Front” has again captured the deepest emotions of men at war.

results.title: Bill and Coo
results.creator_credit: Dean Riesner, Ken Murray and Republic Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: The trials and tribulations of the inhabitants of Chirpendale are enacted entirely by birds, mostly wearing hats and neckties. An eccentricity which won its creator, Ken Murray, a special academy award.

results.title: The Snows of Kilimanjaro
results.creator_credit: Henry King, Darryl F. Zanuck and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A hunter lies wounded in Africa and while waiting for help looks back over his life and loves. Hollywood version of a portable Hemingway, with reminiscences of several novels stirred into a lush and sprawling mix of action and romance, open spaces and smart salons. A big popular star film of its time. Starring Gregory Peck, Susan Hayward and Ava Gardner.

results.title: The Perils of Pauline
results.creator_credit: George Marshall, Sol Siegel and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Fabricated biography of silent serial queen, Pearl White. A frantic re-creation of old time Hollywood, with plenty of slapstick chases. Stars Betty Hutton, Billy De Wolfe, William Demarest, Constance Collier and Frank Faylen. Based on the story by P.J. Wolfson, with credit to Charles W. Goddard who wrote the original serial.

results.title: The Stranger
results.brief_description: An escaped Nazi criminal marries an American woman and settles in a Connecticut village. A highly convincing melodrama - enhanced by directorial touches, splendid photography and no-holds barred climax, involving a church clock.
results.description: An escaped Nazi criminal marries an American woman and settles in a Connecticut village. A highly convincing melodrama - enhanced by directorial touches, splendid photography and no-holds barred climax, involving a church clock.

results.title: I Cover the Waterfront
results.brief_description: A reporter uses a girl’s friendship to expose her father’s smuggling activities. “I Cover the Waterfront” is a tough and daring melodrama about organised crime and the brave men who try to expose it. Stars Claudette Colbert. Rated: G
